Text: Shamayim (שָׁמַיִם), the Hebrew word for "heaven" (literally "heavens", plural), denotes one component of the three-part cosmos, the other elements being "erets" (the earth) and "sheol" (the underworld).

Text: Heaven in Judaism:  "Shamayim" is the dwelling place of God and other heavenly beings, "erets" is the home of the living, and "sheol" is the realm of the dead, including, in post-Hebrew Bible literature (including the Christian New Testament), the abode of the righteous dead.
